movies.title: Les bronzés font du ski
movies.plot: Eight tourists who met in a holiday camp on the Ivory Coast are reunited for a skiing holiday.
movies.simplePlot: Eight tourists who met in a holiday camp on the Ivory Coast are reunited for a skiing holiday.

biography.bio: Josiane Balasko was born on April 15, 1950 in Paris, France as Josiane Balaskovic. She is an actress and writer, known for French Twist (1995), Les bronzés font du ski (1979) and French Fried Vacation (1978). She has been married to George Aguilar since June 12, 2003. She was previously married to Philippe Berry.
biography.name: Josiane Balasko

biography.bio: Michel Blanc was born on April 16, 1952 in Courbevoie, Seine [now Hauts-de-Seine], France. He is an actor and writer, known for The Monster (1994), Monsieur Hire (1989) and Marche à l'ombre (1984).
biography.name: Michel Blanc

biography.bio: Marie-Anne Chazel was born on September 19, 1951 in Gap, Hautes-Alpes, France. She is an actress and writer, known for Les visiteurs (1993), Le père Noël est une ordure (1982) and Les bronzés font du ski (1979). She was previously married to Christian Clavier.
biography.name: Marie-Anne Chazel

biography.bio: Christian Clavier was born on May 6, 1952 in Paris, France. He is an actor and writer, known for Les visiteurs (1993), Les visiteurs en Amérique (2001) and Asterix and Obelix vs. Caesar (1999). He was previously married to Marie-Anne Chazel.
biography.name: Christian Clavier

biography.bio: Gérard Jugnot was born on May 4, 1951 in Paris, France. He is an actor and writer, known for The Chorus (2004), Faubourg 36 (2008) and Une époque formidable... (1991).
biography.name: Gérard Jugnot

biography.bio: Dominique Lavanant was born on April 24, 1944 in Morlaix, Finistère, France. She is an actress and writer, known for The Monster (1994), Paulette (2012) and Three Men and a Cradle (1985).
biography.name: Dominique Lavanant

biography.bio: One of France's most popular actors, writers, and producers, Thierry Lhermitte has been appearing in films since the 1970s. Perhaps best known for work in farcical comedies, the tall, handsome actor has appeared in some of France's more outrageous films over the course of his prolific career. Born in Paris on November 24, 1952, Lhermitte began his career as one of the founding members of the comedy troupe Le Splendid. Among the troupe's other founders were Patrice Leconte, Josiane Balasko, and Michel Blanc, all of whom Lhermitte would collaborate with on future films. After his film debut in Bertrand Blier's Les Valseuses (1974) and a supporting role in Bertrand Tavernier's Que La Fête Commence... (1975), Lhermitte had his first screen collaboration with his Le Splendid colleagues, co-writing and acting in Leconte's Les Bronzés (1978). A farcical satire about a group of French tourists vacationing in Africa, the film proved to be phenomenally popular in France, inspiring a sequel the next year and a dedicated cult following. Lhermitte subsequently made his mark starring in a number of comedies, including Les Hommes Preferent les Grosses (1981) with Balasko, Jean-Loup Hubert's L'Année Prochaine...Si Tout Va Bien (1981) with Isabelle Adjani, and Blier's La Femme De Mon Pote (1983). He maintained a prolific work schedule throughout the '80s and '90s, continuing to play the romantic lead in comedies of every possible variety for a diverse array of directors. Lhermitte also continued to collaborate with his Le Splendid colleagues, starring in Leconte's 1993 Tango as a man intent on murdering his wife after she leaves him, and alongside Balasko in Grosse Fatigue, a comedy that featured Michel Blanc both directing and acting in a double role. In 1998, Lhermitte had one of his greatest successes to date as one of the stars of Francis Veber's Le Dîner de Cons. A witty comedy of manners, it featured the actor in top form as an arrogant publisher put in his place by the seemingly moronic man (Jacques Villeret) he has invited to his weekly dinner of idiots. One of the most popular films to be released in France in years, it was a phenomenal hit with critics and audiences alike. In addition to acting, Lhermitte has continued to work as a screenwriter and producer. In 1994, he wrote, produced, and starred in the children's comedy Un Indien dans la Ville; three years later he served as the associate producer for its American remake, Jungle 2 Jungle. ~ Rebecca Flint Marx, Rovi Children: Victor Lhermitte, Louise Lhermitte, Astree Lhermitte-Soka Father: Andre Lhermitte
biography.name: Thierry Lhermitte

biography.bio: Bruno Moynot was born on December 20, 1950 in Bois-Colombes, Hauts-de-Seine, France. He is an actor and writer, known for Le père Noël est une ordure (1982), Les bronzés font du ski (1979) and French Fried Vacation (1978).
biography.name: Bruno Moynot

biography.bio: Maurice Chevit made his theatrical début just after the Second World War, and made his first screen appearance in 1946 in René Clément's film Le Père tranquille. In August 1950, the Theatre de la Huchette in Paris presented Pepita ou Cinq cents francs de bonheur, a three-act comedy that Chevit co-wrote with Henri Fontenille; Chevit himself appeared in it, playing alongside Jacqueline Maillan, Pierre Mondy and Jacques Jouanneau. He was seen in many small film roles during the 1950s and 1960s, working with producers such as Henri Decoin and André Cayatte, but he was best known as a stage actor.
biography.name: Maurice Chevit

biography.bio: Hélène Aubert is an actress and editor, known for Les bronzés font du ski (1979), Dounia (1998) and Manques (2003).
biography.name: Hélène Aubert

biography.bio: Maurice Aufair is an actor, known for Les bronzés font du ski (1979), South of the Clouds (2003) and Jonah Who Will Be 25 in the Year 2000 (1976).
biography.name: Maurice Aufair

biography.bio: Marlene Auffret is an actress, known for Les bronzés font du ski (1979), Les filles du régiment (1978) and Au bout du bout du banc (1979).
biography.name: Marlene Auffret

biography.bio: Fernand Bonnevie was born on January 18, 1915 in Val-d'Isère, Savoie, France. He was an actor, known for Les bronzés font du ski (1979). He died on May 26, 2013 in Val d'Isère, Savoie.
biography.name: Fernand Bonnevie

biography.bio: Isabelle de Botton was born on April 15, 1952 in Alexandria, Egypt. She is an actress and writer, known for Trois filles en cavale (2011), À trois c'est mieux (2004) and Les bronzés font du ski (1979).
biography.name: Isabelle de Botton

biography.bio: Roland Giraud was born on February 14, 1942 in Rabat, Morocco. He is an actor, known for Three Men and a Cradle (1985), La cage dorée (2013) and Papy fait de la résistance (1983). He has been married to Maaike Jansen since 1966. They have one child.
biography.name: Roland Giraud
